title: Craven Corbyn has run away from this election for far too long
text:
For the third time of asking, the Labour Party last night declined to support a motion for a general election tabled by the Government under the Fixed-term Parliaments Act (FTPA) that required the backing of two-thirds of MPs.

It is an extraordinary state of affairs that the main party of opposition, which has derided the premiership of Boris Johnson and called for an election on umpteen occasions, is unwilling to face the electorate. Jeremy Corbyn has changed his reasons for ducking the challenge at least three times.

First, he insisted that the so-called Benn Act which forced the Government to seek an extension to the UK’s membership of the EU must be given Royal Assent. After that, he said,...
description: For the third time of asking, the Labour Party last night declined to support a motion for a general election tabled by the Government under the Fixed-term Parliaments Act (FTPA) that required the backing of two-thirds of MPs.
